required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Air Travel on Passenger Cognitive Functions
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Air Travel on Passenger Cognitive Functions

brief_summary.textblock: In the period from June 2021 to June 2022, a prospective clinical study will be conducted in the Republic of Kazakhstan with economy class passengers traveling by plane with a minimum flight period of 5-7 flight hours in the territory of the Republic of Kazakhstan.

primary_outcome.description: Ultrasound examination of the veins of the lower limbs
Changes from normal (0 to 5) while jetlag rating was recorded on a scale from 0 = insignificant jetlag to 10 = severe jetlag

primary_outcome.measure: Lake Louise Acute Mountain Sickness Assessment System
primary_outcome.description: Mild acute mountain sicknessas 3-5 points, moderate acute mountain sickness as 6-9 points, and severe acute mountain sickness as 10-12 points

primary_outcome.measure: Neuropsychological tests (Trail Making Test, Wechsler Memory Scale - IV, Free recall
primary_outcome.description: Word, color, and color-word T-Scores of 40 or less are considered "low." Word, color, and color-word T-Scores above 40 or are considered "normal." In order for one score to be considered "higher" or "lower" than another, a 10 point or greater T score difference is required.

secondary_outcome.description: Changes from normal (0 to 5) while jetlag rating was recorded on a scale from 0 = insignificant jetlag to 10 = severe jetlag

secondary_outcome.measure: Lake Louise Acute Mountain Sickness Assessment System
secondary_outcome.description: Mild acute mountain sicknessas 3-5 points, moderate acute mountain sickness as 6-9 points, and severe acute mountain sickness as 10-12 points

Word, color, and color-word T-Scores of 40 or less are considered "low." Word, color, and color-word T-Scores above 40 or are considered "normal." In order for one score to be considered "higher" or "lower" than another, a 10 point or greater T score difference is required.

arm_group.description: Before the flight in the conditions of the clinic's medical treatment room: Citicoline 500 mg(Vitaae®) and Cytochrome10 mg (Cytochrome C®) per os. 30 minutes before the flight: dilute 1 sachet of ORS® (Sodium Chloride 2.6 g+Potassium Chloride 1.5 g+Sodium Citrate 2.90 g+Dextrose 13.5 g) in 1 liter of water. Drink half of the solution (0.5 l) 30 minutes before the flight (at the airport). Also, 0.5 L of the solution will be provided on the plane during landing. If the flight lasts more than 1.5 hours, then dilute the second sachet of ORS® with 0.5-1 liters of water. 30 minutes before the flight (per os): Domperidone (Motilium ®) (1 tablet), Simethicone (Gas-X®) (3-4 capsules), Acetylsalicylic acid 150 mg and magnesium hydroxide 30,39 mg (Cardiomagnyl®)(1 tablet), probiotic (Bactistatin®) (1 capsule) per os.
Melatonin® 5 mg per os 2 hours before bedtime on the day of arrival for 3-4 days.
